items.title: Man Dies After Car Runs Off Road On I-44 In Webster Groves
items.excerpt: A Fenton man died Tuesday night after his car ran off the road on Interstate 44 in Webster Groves. He was 66 years old. The accident happened at 5:05 p.m. on Nov. 25 when the man was driving westbound on I-44 near Edgar Road and his Kia Rio traveled off the right side of the road and struck a guardrail,

items.title: Michael “Mike” Mullen
items.excerpt: Mullen, Michael “Mike,” aged 77, lifelong resident of Kirkwood, Missouri, passed away peacefully on Sunday, Nov. 16, 2025, after a long and well-lived life. items.title: Julian Cornelius “Budgie/J.C.” Cole
items.excerpt: Cole, Julian Cornelius “Budgie/J.C.,” 75, of Kansas City, Missouri, passed away on Nov. 20, 2025, after a period of illness. Born on Feb. 10, 1950, in St. Louis, he attended J. Milton Turner School and graduated from Lindbergh High School in 1968. He proudly served in the U.S. Navy during the Vietnam War until his honorable discharge in 1972. After

items.title: Simplicity
items.excerpt: It’s that time of year when I, along with the staff of the Webster-Kirkwood Times, get to tell all our readers and advertisers how thankful we are for your support. We couldn’t do it without you, and we are indeed honored to serve. Thank you for keeping the wheels of our communities spinning! I’m also thankful for my family and
items.ai_summary: The author expresses gratitude to readers, advertisers, family, and friends during Thanksgiving. He shares a nostalgic story about gifting his brother a vintage Evel Knievel Stunt Cycle and reflects on a recent vacation where he read 'The Catcher in the Rye' for the first time. The book sparked multiple meaningful connections during the trip, including its publication year, its influence on Paul Simon's song 'America,' and its link to John Lennon's assassin. The column emphasizes appreciating the simplicity of life, family, and friends, wishing readers a happy Thanksgiving.
items.community_impact: Impact unclear based on automatically extracted text.

items.title: Zootopia 2
items.ai_summary:
release_date: 2025-11-26
plot_overview: Judy Hopps and Nick Wilde are rookie officers in Zootopia trying to prove their innocence after being framed for kidnapping during an investigation of a smuggling ring targeting the Zootenial Gala.
key_characters:
  -: Judy Hopps (Ginnifer Goodwin)
  -: Nick Wilde (Jason Bateman)
  -: Chief Bogo (Idris Elba)
  -: Gary De’Snake (Ke Huy Quan)
  -: Milton Lynxley (David Strathairn)
  -: Pawbert Lynxley (Andy Samberg)
  -: Nibbles Maplestick (Fortune Feimster)
review_highlights:
  tone: Balanced, fun, and funny
  audience: Primarily children but with Easter Eggs for adults
  animation: Vibrant colors and distinctive characters
  story_complexity: More exposition than typical for animated films, causing some slow moments for kids
  themes: Teamwork, embracing differences
  voice_acting: Strong performances
  director: Jared Bush
items.community_impact: Impact unclear based on automatically extracted text.

items.title: Eternity
items.ai_summary:
release_date: 2025-11-26
genre: Romantic Comedy
plot: Joan must decide where to spend eternity within a week, choosing between her first love Luke, who died young, or her second husband Larry, with whom she spent 65 years. The story explores this complicated love triangle in the afterlife.
key_cast:
  Joan: Elizabeth Olsen
  Luke: Callum Turner
  Larry: Miles Teller
  Anna: Da’Vine Joy Randolph
  Ryan: John Early
  Older Larry: Barry Primus
  Older Joan: Betty Buckley
director: David Freyne
screenwriters:
  -: David Freyne
  -: Patrick Cunnane
production_design: Zazu Myers
review_highlights:
  -: Delightful performances from the main cast with strong chemistry.
  -: Blends fantastical afterlife elements with real-life relationship complexities.
  -: Heartfelt and likely to evoke both laughter and tears.
  -: Clever production design depicting the afterlife's 'Junction' with various whimsical destinations.
  -: Sentimental and relatable without explicit or shocking content.
themes:
  -: Afterlife and eternity decisions
  -: Love and relationships
  -: Reflection on life choices and 'what ifs'
  -: Balancing fantasy and reality
tone: Endearing, cozy, and sentimental romantic comedy
items.community_impact: Impact unclear based on automatically extracted text.

items.title: 2025 Kirkwood Holiday Walk
items.excerpt: At last Saturday’s Kirkwood Holiday Walk, adults enjoyed shopping for holiday gifts offered by Downtown Kirkwood’s unique specialty stores. The Lucille Rapp Tumblers and Dancers performed at Station Plaza, and children were delighted by the Amtrak arrival of Santa and…
items.ai_summary: The 2025 Kirkwood Holiday Walk featured holiday shopping at Downtown Kirkwood's specialty stores, a performance by the Lucille Rapp Tumblers and Dancers at Station Plaza, and a special arrival of Santa and Mrs. Claus by Amtrak, delighting children.
items.community_impact: Impact unclear based on automatically extracted text.
